bugs.title: CVE-2016-4020 Qemu: i386: leakage of stack memory to guest in kvmvapic.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-4020 Qemu: i386: leakage of stack memory to guest in kvmvapic.c

long_desc.thetext:
Qemu emulator built with the Task Priority Register(TPR) optimizations for 32-bit Windows guests, is vulnerable to a information leakage issue. It could
occur while accessing Task Priority Register(TPR).

A privileged user/process inside guest could use this issue to leak host memory bytes.

Upstream patch:
---------------
  -> https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2016-04/msg01118.html

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/04/14/3

Acknowledgments:

Name: Donghai Zdh (Alibaba Inc.)

Created qemu tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1326904]
qemu-2.6.0-3.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
qemu-2.4.1-10.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
qemu-2.3.1-15.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Statement:

This has been rated as having Moderate security impact and is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle:
https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2017:1856 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1856

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat OpenStack Platform 10.0 (Newton)
  Red Hat OpenStack Platform 11.0 (Ocata)
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform 6.0 (Juno) for RHEL 7
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform 7.0 (Kilo) for RHEL 7
  Red Hat OpenStack Platform 8.0 (Liberty)
  Red Hat OpenStack Platform 9.0 (Mitaka)

Via RHSA-2017:2408 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2408

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  RHEV 4.X RHEV-H and Agents for RHEL-7

Via RHSA-2017:2392 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2392

bugs.title: CVE-2016-4439 Qemu: scsi: esp: OOB write while writing to 's->cmdbuf' in esp_reg_write

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-4439 Qemu: scsi: esp: OOB write while writing to 's->cmdbuf' in esp_reg_write

long_desc.thetext:
Quick Emulator(Qemu) built with the ESP/NCR53C9x controller emulation support
is vulnerable to an OOB write access issue. The controller uses 16-byte FIFO
buffer for command and data transfer. The OOB write occurs while writing to
this command buffer in esp_reg_write().

A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the Qemu process
resulting in DoS OR potentially leverage it to execute arbitrary code with
privileges of the Qemu process on the host.

Upstream patch:
---------------
  -> https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2016-05/msg03273.html

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/05/19/3

Acknowledgments:

Name: Li Qiang (360.cn Inc.)

bugs.title: CVE-2016-4441 Qemu: scsi: esp: OOB write while writing to 's->cmdbuf' in get_cmd

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-4441 Qemu: scsi: esp: OOB write while writing to 's->cmdbuf' in get_cmd

long_desc.thetext:
Quick Emulator(Qemu) built with the ESP/NCR53C9x controller emulation support
is vulnerable to an OOB write access issue. The controller uses 16-byte FIFO
buffer for command and data transfer. The OOB write occurs while writing to
this command buffer in routine get_cmd().

A privileged user inside guest could use this flaw to crash the Qemu process
resulting in DoS.

Upstream patch:
---------------
  -> https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2016-05/msg03274.html

Reference:
----------
  -> http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/05/19/4

comment.text: Bug #1339267 (Windows 7 installer...) is fixed and no regressions encountered after the update.

long_desc.thetext:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #1339267 +++

Description of problem:
There is a regression in the recent qemu-kvm package which prevents Windows 7 guest OS from being installed.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
qemu-kvm-2.4.1-9.fc23

How reproducible:
100%

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Boot into Windows 7 x86 or x64 installer

Actual results:
Installer is stuck on the "Starting Windows" screen with the animation still going.

Expected results:
Installer makes progress.

qemu-kvm-2.3.1-14.fc22
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1339267 ***

Description of problem:
There is a regression in the recent qemu-kvm package which prevents Windows 7 guest OS from being installed.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
qemu-kvm-2.4.1-9.fc23

How reproducible:
100%

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Boot into Windows 7 x86 or x64 installer

Actual results:
Installer is stuck on the "Starting Windows" screen with the animation still going.

Expected results:
Installer makes progress.

Additional info:
blamed on CVE-2016-3710: incorrect bounds checking in vga (bz #1334345)
